alert.note: Alert for Allen; Barren; Cumberland; Metcalfe; Monroe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 12 at 6:01PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Monroe, southeastern Allen, northwestern Cumberland, southeastern Barren and southern Metcalfe Counties through 545 PM CDT... At 501 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Glasgow to 7 miles northeast of Westmoreland. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of southern Metcalfe, Monroe, northwestern Cumberland, southeastern Allen and southeastern Barren Counties, including the following locations... Eighty Eight, Oak Forest, Curtis, Gum Tree, Maynard, Harlan Crossroads, Willow Shade, Gamaliel, Austin and Nobob. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
